Melee Weapons.name: Unarmed
Melee Weapons.desc: Basic hand-to-hand strikes with fists, kicks, and elbows. Damage can be improved with training.

Melee Weapons.name: Brass Knuckles/Steel-toe boots
Melee Weapons.desc: A simple, concealable force-multiplier for unarmed strikes, or using a heavy, blunt object.

Melee Weapons.name: Garotte
Melee Weapons.desc: A wire or cord for silent strangulation. Works only from surprise. On success, target is pinned and silenced, taking 1D6 damage per round until escape. Kevlar cord can cut flex-cuffs.

Melee Weapons.name: Knife
Melee Weapons.desc: A small, single-edged blade. Common and easily concealable.

Melee Weapons.name: Hatchet
Melee Weapons.desc: A small, short-handled axe for chopping, utility, or combat.

Melee Weapons.name: Large knife/Combat dagger
Melee Weapons.desc: A dedicated combat knife with a larger, often double-edged blade for increased lethality.

Melee Weapons.name: Club/Baton
Melee Weapons.desc: A blunt instrument designed for subduing targets through impact.
Melee Weapons.examples: e.g., Police nightstick, collapsible ASP baton.

Melee Weapons.name: Machete/Tomahawk/Sword
Melee Weapons.desc: A large, heavy blade or axe designed for clearing brush or as a formidable weapon.

Melee Weapons.name: Baseball bat/Rifle butt
Melee Weapons.desc: A heavy club for sport or improvised combat. A rifle can be used as a club in melee.
Melee Weapons.examples: e.g., Louisville Slugger, rifle stock strike.

Melee Weapons.name: Spear/Fixed bayonet
Melee Weapons.desc: A pole weapon with a pointed tip, effective at keeping enemies at a distance or for thrusting attacks.

Melee Weapons.name: Wood axe
Melee Weapons.desc: A heavy, typically two-handed axe for felling trees, breaching doors, or causing massive trauma.

Melee Weapons.name: Large sword
Melee Weapons.desc: A one-handed sword, requiring training but highly effective for cutting and thrusting in combat.

Melee Weapons.name: Two-handed sword
Melee Weapons.desc: A massive blade requiring two hands, delivering devastating blows with superior reach.

Firearms.name: Light Pistol
Firearms.desc: Small-caliber sidearms, easily concealable but lacking stopping power.
Firearms.examples: e.g., Ruger SR22, Walther PPK, Colt Detective Special

Firearms.name: Medium Pistol
Firearms.desc: Standard-issue service pistols, balancing magazine capacity and effectiveness.
Firearms.examples: e.g., Glock 19, SIG Sauer P226, Beretta M9

Firearms.name: Heavy Pistol
Firearms.desc: Large-caliber handguns and revolvers known for their immense stopping power.
Firearms.examples: e.g., Desert Eagle .50 AE, S&W Model 29, Colt Python

Firearms.name: Shotgun (Nonlethal)
Firearms.desc: Fires beanbag rounds or rubber slugs designed to incapacitate targets without lethal force.

Firearms.name: Shotgun (Shot)
Firearms.desc: Fires a spread of pellets, devastating at close range.

Firearms.name: Shotgun (Slug)
Firearms.desc: Fires a single, solid projectile for greater range and accuracy.

Firearms.name: Submachine Gun
Firearms.desc: Compact, automatic weapons ideal for close-quarters combat. RESTRICTED.
Firearms.examples: e.g., H&K MP5, FN P90, IMI Uzi

Firearms.name: Light Rifle/Carbine
Firearms.desc: Standard military assault rifles, versatile for most combat scenarios. RESTRICTED.
Firearms.examples: e.g., M4A1, AK-74, Steyr AUG, SIG MCX

Firearms.name: Heavy Rifle
Firearms.desc: Battle rifles firing full-power cartridges for superior range and penetration. RESTRICTED.
Firearms.examples: e.g., FN FAL, H&K G3, M14, Dragunov SVD

Firearms.name: Very Heavy Rifle
Firearms.desc: High-caliber sniper and anti-materiel rifles for extreme long-range engagements. RESTRICTED.
Firearms.examples: e.g., Barrett M82A1, McMillan TAC-50, CheyTac M200

Heavy Weapons.name: Hand grenade
Heavy Weapons.desc: Thrown explosive with a timed fuse. Kill Radius: 10m. RESTRICTED.

Heavy Weapons.name: Handheld flamethrower
Heavy Weapons.desc: A portable incendiary device that projects a stream of fire. Kill Radius: 1m.

Heavy Weapons.name: Military flamethrower
Heavy Weapons.desc: A backpack-fed incendiary weapon with greater range and fuel capacity. Kill Radius: 2m. RESTRICTED.

Heavy Weapons.name: Light machine gun (LMG)
Heavy Weapons.desc: An automatic rifle designed for sustained suppressive fire at the squad level. Kill Radius: Burst Length. RESTRICTED.
Heavy Weapons.examples: e.g., FN MINIMI (M249 SAW), Molot RPK.

Heavy Weapons.name: General-purpose machine gun (GPMG)
Heavy Weapons.desc: A medium machine gun, effective in both offensive and defensive roles. Kill Radius: Burst Length. RESTRICTED.
Heavy Weapons.examples: e.g., FN MAG (M240), Kovrov PKM, Saco M60.

Heavy Weapons.name: Minigun
Heavy Weapons.desc: An electrically-driven, multi-barrel rotary machine gun with an extremely high rate of fire. Kill Radius: Long spray. RESTRICTED.
Heavy Weapons.examples: e.g., Dillon GAU-17/A, GE M134, KBP GShG-7.62.

Heavy Weapons.name: Heavy machine gun (HMG)
Heavy Weapons.desc: A large-caliber machine gun, typically mounted, effective against infantry and light vehicles. Kill Radius: Burst Length. RESTRICTED.
Heavy Weapons.examples: e.g., Browning M2HB, Degtyaryov DShKM, Kovrov NSV.

Heavy Weapons.name: Autocannon
Heavy Weapons.desc: A large-caliber automatic gun firing explosive shells, too large for a single person to operate. Kill Radius: 3m. RESTRICTED.

Heavy Weapons.name: Grenade launcher (GL)
Heavy Weapons.desc: A single-shot weapon that fires explosive grenades further than they can be thrown. Revolver capacity: 6. Kill Radius: 10m. RESTRICTED.
Heavy Weapons.examples: e.g., Colt M203, H&K M320, Milkor M32, Springfield M79.

Heavy Weapons.name: Grenade machine gun (GMG)
Heavy Weapons.desc: An automatic, belt-fed grenade launcher for sustained fire support. *If firing a burst (5 grenades), Lethality is 20%. Kill Radius: 10m. RESTRICTED.
Heavy Weapons.examples: e.g., H&K GMG, Saco MK 19 MOD 3, KBP AGS-17.

Heavy Weapons.name: Rocket-propelled grenade launcher (RPG)
Heavy Weapons.desc: A shoulder-fired anti-tank weapon that launches a rocket with an explosive warhead. Kill Radius: 10m. RESTRICTED.
Heavy Weapons.examples: e.g., ATK M72 LAW, Bazalt RPG-7V, Bofors AT4 (M136).

Electro-Shock.name: Stun Gun
Electro-Shock.desc: A close-range electroshock weapon designed to incapacitate through pain compliance.

Electro-Shock.name: Shock Baton
Electro-Shock.desc: A melee-range electroshock weapon for crowd control or subduing resistant targets.
Electro-Shock.examples: e.g., Maglite Stun Gun Baton, Police-grade stun baton.

Electro-Shock.name: CED Pistol
Electro-Shock.desc: A ranged electroshock weapon that fires wired projectiles to immobilize a target from a distance.

Grenades & Chemical.name: Flash Grenade (Thrown)
Grenades & Chemical.desc: Non-lethal explosive device that produces a blinding flash and deafening bang to disorient targets.

Grenades & Chemical.name: Flash Grenade (Launched)
Grenades & Chemical.desc: Grenade launcher variant of the flash grenade for greater range.

Grenades & Chemical.name: Pepper Spray Keychain
Grenades & Chemical.desc: A small, concealable canister of oleoresin capsicum for self-defense.

Grenades & Chemical.name: Pepper Spray Can
Grenades & Chemical.desc: A larger canister of oleoresin capsicum for crowd control or more sustained use.

Grenades & Chemical.name: Tear Gas (Thrown)
Grenades & Chemical.desc: Canister that releases a chemical agent (CS or CN gas) causing severe irritation and temporary blindness.

Grenades & Chemical.name: Tear Gas (Launched)
Grenades & Chemical.desc: Grenade launcher variant of the tear gas canister for area denial at range.

Demolitions.name: Det Cord/Extrudable Explosive
Demolitions.desc: 500g of flexible explosive cord or plastic explosive for precise cutting or breaching. Kill Radius: 5m. RESTRICTED.

Demolitions.name: Improvised Explosive (IED)
Demolitions.desc: A homemade bomb, often powerful but potentially unreliable. Ingredients are not restricted. Kill Radius: 10m. RESTRICTED.

Demolitions.name: Bundled IED
Demolitions.desc: Multiple IEDs wired together for a much larger blast. Kill Radius: 20m. RESTRICTED.
Demolitions.examples: e.g., A series of pipe bombs.

Demolitions.name: Explosively-Formed Penetrator
Demolitions.desc: A special type of charge designed to fire a molten metal slug capable of defeating heavy armor. Kill Radius: 10m. RESTRICTED.

Demolitions.name: ANFO Explosive
Demolitions.desc: A powerful, bulk industrial explosive made from ammonium nitrate and fuel oil. Kill Radius: 20m. RESTRICTED.
Demolitions.examples: e.g., Fertilizer and fuel oil mixture.
